summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated July 23, 2019, discussing efforts to contact a potential witness or victim. The prosecutor is coordinating with the individual's attorney to arrange a meeting, noting the person is not great at following up. The document is subject to a protective order.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, working in the Southern District of New York, is attempting to arrange contact with a potential witness or victim through her attorney.

connections.description: The prosecutor is communicating with the attorney of a potential witness/victim to facilitate contact with their client.

events.title: Prosecutor Follow-up on Witness Contact
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends an email to coordinate contacting a potential witness or victim, having spoken with her attorney who provided her contact information.

keyFacts: The document is an email from a federal prosecutor dated July 23, 2019, showing active investigation efforts.
The prosecutor is attempting to contact a female individual through her attorney, who provided her current phone number.
The attorney indicated the individual is 'not great at following up,' suggesting potential challenges in securing cooperation.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs, indicating sensitive content.
The communication is part of the Epstein case investigation in the Southern District of New York.
